required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Non-CE Marked Intermittent Catheters.
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Investigation on Performance and Safety of Newly Developed Intermittent Catheters in Male Users of Intermittent Catheters

brief_summary.textblock: Investigation of non-CE marked intermittent catheters. The study is a randomized, single blinded, cross-over investigation comparing two new catheters with a comparator catheter.

detailed_description.textblock: The CP323 study is an investigation of non-CE marked intermittent catheters (IC) which will be conducted in Denmark. The study is a randomized, single blinded, cross-over investigation comparing two new catheters with a comparator catheter in 15 male IC users.

primary_outcome.description: Volume of residual urine at 1st clogging assessed by a pressure sensor with time-logged weighing.

secondary_outcome.description: Volume of residual urine post catheterization assessed by ultrasound scan

Discomfort measured using Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). A tool used to help a person rate the intensity of certain sensations and feelings, such as pain. The visual analog scale for pain/discomfort is a straight line of 10 cm with one end meaning no pain/discomfort and the other end meaning the worst pain/discomfort imaginable. The subject marks a point on the line that matches the amount of pain/discomfort he or she feels.

intervention.intervention_name: New intermittent catheters variation 1 and 2 for males
intervention.description: The new catheters are not named at this point but are intended for intermittent drainage of the bladder.
intervention.arm_group_label: New intermittent catheter variation 1 for male
New intermittent catheter variation 2 for male

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male
2. Is at least 18 years of age and has full legal capacity
3. Has given written informed consent, signed letter of authority and signed secrecy agreement
4. Should have used an intermittent catheter bladder management method daily, with at least 2 catheters used in average per day, during the last 3 months
5. Ability to self-catheterise
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Participation in any other clinical study during this investigation
2. Symptoms of urinary tract infection as judged by the investigator
3. Any know allergies towards ingredients in the products
4. Relevant medical history that would prevent the subject to participate in the investigation (investigators judgement)
